ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to develop a research question and write a compelling research paper.

Working on the one-term senior essay taught me how much diligence it requires to work on a project for a significant amount of time. I learned how to pick a topic, do the research and work through the struggle of fine-tuning an argument/thesis. The senior essay taught me how helpful it is to have an advisor willing to give advice and how important it is to keep reaching out to them.
Learned a lot about researching and developing ideas.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: 480 was great  highly recommend it to students writing their thesis. It gives you the flexibility to explore a topic on your own.

Since I did independent research for my senior thesis, it's up to the student to invest time and seek guidance from faculty. However, I did feel as if the department did not provide much information to students during their junior year to help prepare them for the senior year thesis process.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Take 480 if you have an advisor in mind.

I would recommend this course to any other student that is willing to engage in the research and writing process on their own, without the guidance of weekly in-class meetings with a professor who prescribes the readings for each week. I would especially recommend it to students who already have a topic in mind going into the year and can develop their thought process on their own.
